  34. ‌char * default_runtime_name = RUNTIME_NAME;

  37. #ifdef _MSC_VER
  38. __forceinline
  39. #else
  40. __inline
  41. #endif
  42. ‌unsigned long read_size(const char * const ptr)
  43. {
  44.   const unsigned char * const p = (const unsigned char * const) ptr;
  45.   return ((unsigned long) p[0] << 24) | ((unsigned long) p[1] << 16) |
  46.          ((unsigned long) p[2] << 8) | p[3];
  47. }

  49. ‌static __inline char * read_runtime_path(HANDLE h)
  50. {
  51.   char buffer[TRAILER_SIZE];
  52.   static char runtime_path[MAX_PATH];
  53.   DWORD nread;
  54.   int num_sections, path_size, i;
  55.   long ofs;

  57.   if (SetFilePointer(h, -TRAILER_SIZE, NULL, FILE_END) == -1) return NULL;
  58.   if (! ReadFile(h, buffer, TRAILER_SIZE, &nread, NULL)) return NULL;
  59.   if (nread != TRAILER_SIZE) return NULL;
  60.   num_sections = read_size(buffer);
  61.   ofs = TRAILER_SIZE + num_sections * 8;
  62.   if (SetFilePointer(h, - ofs, NULL, FILE_END) == -1) return NULL;
  63.   path_size = 0;
  64.   for (i = 0; i < num_sections; i++) {
  65.     if (! ReadFile(h, buffer, 8, &nread, NULL) || nread != 8) return NULL;
  66.     if (buffer[0] == 'R' && buffer[1] == 'N' &&
  67.         buffer[2] == 'T' && buffer[3] == 'M') {
  68.       path_size = read_size(buffer + 4);
  69.       ofs += path_size;
  70.     } else if (path_size > 0)
  71.       ofs += read_size(buffer + 4);
  72.   }
  73.   if (path_size == 0) return default_runtime_name;
  74.   if (path_size >= MAX_PATH) return NULL;
  75.   if (SetFilePointer(h, -ofs, NULL, FILE_END) == -1) return NULL;
  76.   if (! ReadFile(h, runtime_path, path_size, &nread, NULL)) return NULL;
  77.   if (nread != path_size) return NULL;
  78.   runtime_path[path_size - 1] = 0;
  79.   return runtime_path;
  80. }

  82. ‌static BOOL WINAPI ctrl_handler(DWORD event)
  83. {
  84.   if (event == CTRL_C_EVENT || event == CTRL_BREAK_EVENT)
  85.     return TRUE;                /* pretend we've handled them */
  86.   else
  87.     return FALSE;
  88. }

  90. #if WINDOWS_UNICODE
  91. ‌#define CP CP_UTF8
  92. #else
  93. ‌#define CP CP_ACP
  94. #endif

  96. ‌static void write_console(HANDLE hOut, WCHAR *wstr)
  97. {
  98.   DWORD consoleMode, numwritten, len;
  99.   static char str[MAX_PATH];

  101.   if (GetConsoleMode(hOut, &consoleMode) != 0) {
  102.     /* The output stream is a Console */
  103.     WriteConsole(hOut, wstr, wcslen(wstr), &numwritten, NULL);
  104.   } else { /* The output stream is redirected */
  105.     len =
  106.       WideCharToMultiByte(CP, 0, wstr, wcslen(wstr), str, sizeof(str),
  107.                           NULL, NULL);
  108.     WriteFile(hOut, str, len, &numwritten, NULL);
  109.   }
  110. }

  112. ‌static __inline void __declspec(noreturn) run_runtime(wchar_t * runtime,
  113.          wchar_t * const cmdline)
  114. {
  115.   wchar_t path[MAX_PATH];
  116.   STARTUPINFO stinfo;
  117.   PROCESS_INFORMATION procinfo;
  118.   DWORD retcode;
  119.   if (SearchPath(NULL, runtime, L".exe", sizeof(path)/sizeof(wchar_t),
  120.                  path, &runtime) == 0) {
  121.     HANDLE errh;
  122.     errh = GetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE);
  123.     write_console(errh, L"Cannot exec ");
  124.     write_console(errh, runtime);
  125.     write_console(errh, L"\r\n");
  126.     ExitProcess(2);
  127. #ifdef _MSC_VER
  128.     __assume(0); /* Not reached */
  129. #endif
  130.   }
  131.   /* Need to ignore ctrl-C and ctrl-break, otherwise we'll die and take
  132.      the underlying OCaml program with us! */
  133.   SetConsoleCtrlHandler(ctrl_handler, TRUE);

  135.   stinfo.cb = sizeof(stinfo);
  136.   stinfo.lpReserved = NULL;
  137.   stinfo.lpDesktop = NULL;
  138.   stinfo.lpTitle = NULL;
  139.   stinfo.dwFlags = 0;
  140.   stinfo.cbReserved2 = 0;
  141.   stinfo.lpReserved2 = NULL;
  142.   if (!CreateProcess(path, cmdline, NULL, NULL, TRUE, 0, NULL, NULL,
  143.                      &stinfo, &procinfo)) {
  144.     HANDLE errh;
  145.     errh = GetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE);
  146.     write_console(errh, L"Cannot exec ");
  147.     write_console(errh, runtime);
  148.     write_console(errh, L"\r\n");
  149.     ExitProcess(2);
  150. #ifdef _MSC_VER
  151.     __assume(0); /* Not reached */
  152. #endif
  153.   }
  154.   CloseHandle(procinfo.hThread);
  155.   WaitForSingleObject(procinfo.hProcess , INFINITE);
  156.   GetExitCodeProcess(procinfo.hProcess , &retcode);
  157.   CloseHandle(procinfo.hProcess);
  158.   ExitProcess(retcode);
  159. #ifdef _MSC_VER
  160.     __assume(0); /* Not reached */
  161. #endif
  162. }

  164. ‌int wmain(void)
  165. {
  166.   wchar_t truename[MAX_PATH];
  167.   wchar_t * cmdline = GetCommandLine();
  168.   char * runtime_path;
  169.   wchar_t wruntime_path[MAX_PATH];
  170.   HANDLE h;

  172.   GetModuleFileName(NULL, truename, sizeof(truename)/sizeof(wchar_t));
  173.   h = CreateFile(truename, GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ | FILE_SHARE_WRITE,
  174.                  NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
  175.   if (h == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE ||
  176.       (runtime_path = read_runtime_path(h)) == NULL) {
  177.     HANDLE errh;
  178.     errh = GetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE);
  179.     write_console(errh, truename);
  180.     write_console(errh, L" not found or is not a bytecode executable file\r\n");
  181.     ExitProcess(2);
  182. #ifdef _MSC_VER
  183.     __assume(0); /* Not reached */
  184. #endif
  185.   }
  186.   CloseHandle(h);
  187.   MultiByteToWideChar(CP, 0, runtime_path, -1, wruntime_path,
  188.                       sizeof(wruntime_path)/sizeof(wchar_t));
  189.   run_runtime(wruntime_path , cmdline);
  190. #ifdef _MSC_VER
  191.     __assume(0); /* Not reached */
  192. #endif
  193. #ifdef __MINGW32__
  194.     return 0;
  195. #endif
  196. }
